column3: And it came to pass when they had left off speaking, that Holofernes being in a violent passion, said to Achior:
six to two.

column2: Because thou hast prophesied unto us, saying: That the nation of Israel is defended by their God, to shew thee that there is no God, but Nabuchodonosor:
column3: Because thou hast prophesied unto us, saying: That the nation of Israel is defended by their God, to shew thee that there is no God, but Nabuchodonosor:
six to three.

column2: When we shall slay them all as one man, then thou also shalt die with them by the sword of the Assyrians, and all Israel shall perish with thee:
column3: When we shall slay them all as one man, then thou also shalt die with them by the sword of the Assyrians, and all Israel shall perish with thee:
six to four.

column2: And thou shalt find that Nabuchodonosor is lord of the whole earth: and then the sword of my soldiers shall pass through thy sides, and thou shalt be stabbed and fall among the wounded of Israel, and thou shalt breathe no more till thou be destroyed with them.
column3: And thou shalt find that Nabuchodonosor is lord of the whole earth: and then the sword of my soldiers shall pass through thy sides, and thou shalt be stabbed and fall among the wounded of Israel, and thou shalt breathe no more till thou be destroyed with them.
six to five.

column2: But if thou think thy prophecy true, let not thy countenance sink, and let the paleness that is in thy face, depart from thee, if thou imaginest these my words cannot be accomplished.
column3: But if thou think thy prophecy true, let not thy countenance sink, and let the paleness that is in thy face, depart from thee, if thou imaginest these my words cannot be accomplished.
six to six.

column2: And that thou mayst know that thou shalt experience these things together with them, behold from this hour thou shalt be associated to their people, that when they shall receive the punishment they deserve from my sword, thou mayst fall under the same vengeance.
column3: And that thou mayst know that thou shalt experience these things together with them, behold from this hour thou shalt be associated to their people, that when they shall receive the punishment they deserve from my sword, thou mayst fall under the same vengeance.
six to seven.

column2: Then Holofernes commanded his servants to take Achior, and to lead him to Bethulia, and to deliver him into the hands of the children of Israel.
column3: Then Holofernes commanded his servants to take Achior, and to lead him to Bethulia, and to deliver him into the hands of the children of Israel.
six to eight.

column2: And the servants of Holofernes taking him, went through the plains: but when they came near the mountains, the slingers came out against them.
column3: And the servants of Holofernes taking him, went through the plains: but when they came near the mountains, the slingers came out against them.
six to nine.

column2: Then turning out of the way by the side of the mountain, they tied Achior to a tree hand and foot, and so left him bound with ropes, and returned to their master.
column3: Then turning out of the way by the side of the mountain, they tied Achior to a tree hand and foot, and so left him bound with ropes, and returned to their master.
six ten.

column2: And the children of Israel coming down from Bethulia, came to him, and loosing him they brought him to Bethulia, and setting him in the midst of the people, asked him what was the matter that the Assyrians had left him bound.
column3: And the children of Israel coming down from Bethulia, came to him, and loosing him they brought him to Bethulia, and setting him in the midst of the people, asked him what was the matter that the Assyrians had left him bound.
six eleven.

column2: In those days the rulers there, were Ozias the son of Micha of the tribe of Simeon, and Charmi, called also Gothoniel.
column3: In those days the rulers there, were Ozias the son of Micha of the tribe of Simeon, and Charmi, called also Gothoniel.
six twelve.

column2: And Achior related in the midst of the ancients, and in the presence of all the people, all that he had said being asked by Holofernes: and how the people of Holofernes would have killed him for this word,
column3: And Achior related in the midst of the ancients, and in the presence of all the people, all that he had said being asked by Holofernes: and how the people of Holofernes would have killed him for this word,
six thirteen.

column2: And how Holofernes himself being angry had commanded him to be delivered for this cause to the Israelites: that when he should overcome the children of Israel, then he might command Achior also himself to be put to death by diverse torments, for having said: The God of heaven is their defender.
column3: And how Holofernes himself being angry had commanded him to be delivered for this cause to the Israelites: that when he should overcome the children of Israel, then he might command Achior also himself to be put to death by diverse torments, for having said: The God of heaven is their defender.
six fourteen.

column2: And when Achior had declared all these things, all the people fell upon their faces, adoring the Lord, and all of them together mourning and weeping poured out their prayers with one accord to the Lord,
column3: And when Achior had declared all these things, all the people fell upon their faces, adoring the Lord, and all of them together mourning and weeping poured out their prayers with one accord to the Lord,
six fifteen.

column2: Saying: O Lord God of heaven and earth, behold their pride, and look on our low condition, and have regard to the face of thy saints, and shew that thou forsakest not them that trust on thee, and that thou humblest them that presume of themselves, and glory in their own strength.
column3: Saying: O Lord God of heaven and earth, behold their pride, and look on our low condition, and have regard to the face of thy saints, and shew that thou forsakest not them that trust on thee, and that thou humblest them that presume of themselves, and glory in their own strength.
six sixteen.

column2: So when their weeping was ended, and the people's prayer, in which they continued all the day, was concluded, they comforted Achior,
column3: So when their weeping was ended, and the people's prayer, in which they continued all the day, was concluded, they comforted Achior,
six seventeen.

column2: Saying: The God of our fathers, whose power thou hast set forth, will make this return to thee, that thou rather shalt see their destruction.
column3: Saying: The God of our fathers, whose power thou hast set forth, will make this return to thee, that thou rather shalt see their destruction.
six eighteen.

column2: And when the Lord our God shall give this liberty to his servants, let God be with thee also in the midst of us: that as it shall please thee, so thou with all thine mayst converse with us.
column3: And when the Lord our God shall give this liberty to his servants, let God be with thee also in the midst of us: that as it shall please thee, so thou with all thine mayst converse with us.
six nineteen.

column2: Then Ozias, after the assembly was broken up, received him into his house, and made him a great supper.
column3: Then Ozias, after the assembly was broken up, received him into his house, and made him a great supper.
six twenty.

column2: And all the ancients were invited, and they refreshed themselves together after their fast was over.
column3: And all the ancients were invited, and they refreshed themselves together after their fast was over.
six twenty one.

column2: And afterwards all the people were called together, and they prayed all the night long within the church, desiring help of the God of Israel.
column3: And afterwards all the people were called together, and they prayed all the night long within the church, desiring help of the God of Israel.

column2: The church...
column3: The church...

column2: That is, the synagogue or place where they met for prayer.
column3: That is, the synagogue or place where they met for prayer.

column2: Judith Chapter 7
column3: Judith Chapter seven

column2: Holofernes besiegeth Bethulia.
column3: Holofernes besiegeth Bethulia.

column2: The distress of the besieged.
column3: The distress of the besieged.
seven to one.

column2: But Holofernes on the next day gave orders to his army, to go up against Bethulia.
column3: But Holofernes on the next day gave orders to his army, to go up against Bethulia.
seven to two.

column2: Now there were in his troops a hundred and twenty thousand footmen, and two and twenty thousand horsemen, besides the preparations of those men who had been taken, and who had been brought away out of the provinces and cities of all the youth.
column3: Now there were in his troops a hundred and twenty thousand footmen, and two and twenty thousand horsemen, besides the preparations of those men who had been taken, and who had been brought away out of the provinces and cities of all the youth.
seven to three.

column2: All these prepared themselves together to fight against the children of Israel, and they came by the hillside to the top, which looketh toward Dothain, from the place which is called Belma, unto Chelmon, which is over against Esdrelon.
column3: All these prepared themselves together to fight against the children of Israel, and they came by the hillside to the top, which looketh toward Dothain, from the place which is called Belma, unto Chelmon, which is over against Esdrelon.
seven to four.

column2: But the children of Israel, when they saw the multitude of them, prostrated themselves upon the ground, putting ashes upon their heads, praying with one accord, that the God of Israel would shew his mercy upon his people.
column3: But the children of Israel, when they saw the multitude of them, prostrated themselves upon the ground, putting ashes upon their heads, praying with one accord, that the God of Israel would shew his mercy upon his people.
seven to five.

column2: And taking their arms of war, they posted themselves at the places, which by a narrow pathway lead directly between the mountains, and they guarded them all day and night.
column3: And taking their arms of war, they posted themselves at the places, which by a narrow pathway lead directly between the mountains, and they guarded them all day and night.
seven to six.

column2: Now Holofernes, in going round about, found that the fountain which supplied them with water, ran through an aqueduct without the city on the south side: and he commanded their aqueduct to be cut off.
column3: Now Holofernes, in going round about, found that the fountain which supplied them with water, ran through an aqueduct without the city on the south side: and he commanded their aqueduct to be cut off.
seven to seven.

column2: Nevertheless there were springs not far from the walls, out of which they were seen secretly to draw water, to refresh themselves a little rather than to drink their fill.
column3: Nevertheless there were springs not far from the walls, out of which they were seen secretly to draw water, to refresh themselves a little rather than to drink their fill.
seven to eight.

column2: But the children of Ammon and Moab came to Holofernes, saying: The children of Israel trust not in their spears, nor in their arrows, but the mountains are their defence, and the steep hills and precipices guard them.
column3: But the children of Ammon and Moab came to Holofernes, saying: The children of Israel trust not in their spears, nor in their arrows, but the mountains are their defence, and the steep hills and precipices guard them.
seven to nine.

column2: Wherefore that thou mayst overcome them without joining battle, set guards at the springs that they may not draw water out of them, and thou shalt destroy them without sword, or at least being wearied out they will yield up their city, which they suppose, because it is situate in the mountains, to be impregnable.
column3: Wherefore that thou mayst overcome them without joining battle, set guards at the springs that they may not draw water out of them, and thou shalt destroy them without sword, or at least being wearied out they will yield up their city, which they suppose, because it is situate in the mountains, to be impregnable.
seven ten.

column2: And these words pleased Holofernes, and his officers, and he placed all round about a hundred men at every spring.
column3: And these words pleased Holofernes, and his officers, and he placed all round about a hundred men at every spring.
seven eleven.

column2: And when they had kept this watch for full twenty days, the cisterns, and the reserve of waters failed among all the inhabitants of Bethulia, so that there was not within the city, enough to satisfy them, no not for one day, for water was daily given out to the people by measure.
column3: And when they had kept this watch for full twenty days, the cisterns, and the reserve of waters failed among all the inhabitants of Bethulia, so that there was not within the city, enough to satisfy them, no not for one day, for water was daily given out to the people by measure.
seven twelve.

column2: Then all the men and women, young men, and children, gathering themselves together to Ozias, all together with one voice,
column3: Then all the men and women, young men, and children, gathering themselves together to Ozias, all together with one voice,
seven thirteen.

column2: Said: God be judge between us and thee, for thou hast done evil against us, in that thou wouldst not speak peaceably with the Assyrians, and for this cause God hath sold us into their hands.
column3: Said: God be judge between us and thee, for thou hast done evil against us, in that thou wouldst not speak peaceably with the Assyrians, and for this cause God hath sold us into their hands.
seven fourteen.

column2: And therefore there is no one to help us, while we are cast down before their eyes in thirst, and sad destruction.
column3: And therefore there is no one to help us, while we are cast down before their eyes in thirst, and sad destruction.
seven fifteen.

column2: And now assemble ye all that are in the city, that we may of our own accord yield ourselves all up to the people of Holofernes.
column3: And now assemble ye all that are in the city, that we may of our own accord yield ourselves all up to the people of Holofernes.
seven sixteen.

column2: For it is better, that being captives we should live and bless the Lord, than that we should die, and be a reproach to all flesh, after we have seen our wives and our infants die before our eyes.
column3: For it is better, that being captives we should live and bless the Lord, than that we should die, and be a reproach to all flesh, after we have seen our wives and our infants die before our eyes.
seven seventeen.

column2: We call to witness this day heaven and earth, and the God of our fathers, who taketh vengeance upon us according to our sins, conjuring you to deliver now the city into the hand of the army of Holofernes, that our end may be short by the edge of the sword, which is made longer by the drought of thirst.
column3: We call to witness this day heaven and earth, and the God of our fathers, who taketh vengeance upon us according to our sins, conjuring you to deliver now the city into the hand of the army of Holofernes, that our end may be short by the edge of the sword, which is made longer by the drought of thirst.
seven eighteen.

column2: And when they had said these things, there was great weeping and lamentation of all in the assembly, and for many hours with one voice they cried to God, saying:
column3: And when they had said these things, there was great weeping and lamentation of all in the assembly, and for many hours with one voice they cried to God, saying:
seven nineteen.

column2: We have sinned with our fathers, we have done unjustly, we have committed iniquity:
column3: We have sinned with our fathers, we have done unjustly, we have committed iniquity:
seven twenty.

column2: Have thou mercy on us, because thou art good, or punish our iniquities by chastising us thyself, and deliver not them that trust in thee to a people that knoweth not thee,
column3: Have thou mercy on us, because thou art good, or punish our iniquities by chastising us thyself, and deliver not them that trust in thee to a people that knoweth not thee,
seven twenty one.

column2: That they may not say among the Gentiles: Where is their God?
column3: That they may not say among the Gentiles: Where is their God?
seven twenty two.

column2: And when being wearied with these cries, and tired with these weepings, they held their peace,
column3: And when being wearied with these cries, and tired with these weepings, they held their peace,
seven twenty three.

column2: Ozias rising up all in tears, said: Be of good courage, my brethren, and let us wait these five days for mercy from the Lord.
column3: Ozias rising up all in tears, said: Be of good courage, my brethren, and let us wait these five days for mercy from the Lord.
seven twenty four.

column2: For perhaps he will put a stop to his indignation, and will give glory to his own name.
column3: For perhaps he will put a stop to his indignation, and will give glory to his own name.
seven twenty five.

column2: But if after five days be past there come no aid, we will do the things which you have spoken.
column3: But if after five days be past there come no aid, we will do the things which you have spoken.

column2: Judith Chapter 8
column3: Judith Chapter eight

column2: The character of Judith: her discourse to the ancients.
column3: The character of Judith: her discourse to the ancients.
eight to one.

column2: Now it came to pass, when Judith a widow had heard these words, who was the daughter of Merari, the son of Idox, the son of Joseph, the son of Ozias, the son of Elai, the son of Jamnor, the son of Gedeon, the son of Raphaim, the son of Achitob, the son of Melchias, the son of Enan, the son of Nathanias, the son of Salathiel, the son of Simeon, the son of Ruben:
column3: Now it came to pass, when Judith a widow had heard these words, who was the daughter of Merari, the son of Idox, the son of Joseph, the son of Ozias, the son of Elai, the son of Jamnor, the son of Gedeon, the son of Raphaim, the son of Achitob, the son of Melchias, the son of Enan, the son of Nathanias, the son of Salathiel, the son of Simeon, the son of Ruben:

column2: Simeon the son of Ruben...
column3: Simeon the son of Ruben...

column2: In the Greek, it is the son of Israel.
column3: In the Greek, it is the son of Israel.

column2: For Simeon the patriarch, from whom Judith descended, was not the son, but the brother of Ruben.
column3: For Simeon the patriarch, from whom Judith descended, was not the son, but the brother of Ruben.

column2: It seems more probable that the Simeon and the Ruben here mentioned are not the patriarchs: but two of the descendants of the patriarch Simeon: and that the genealogy of Judith, recorded in this place, is not carried up so high as the patriarchs.
column3: It seems more probable that the Simeon and the Ruben here mentioned are not the patriarchs: but two of the descendants of the patriarch Simeon: and that the genealogy of Judith, recorded in this place, is not carried up so high as the patriarchs.

column2: No more than that of Elcana the father of Samuel, 1 Kings 1.1, and that of king Saul, 1 Kings 9.1.
column3: No more than that of Elcana the father of Samuel, first kings one point one, and that of king Saul, first kings nine point one.
eight to two.

column2: And her husband was Manasses, who died in the time of the barley harvest:
column3: And her husband was Manasses, who died in the time of the barley harvest:
eight to three.

column2: For he was standing over them that bound sheaves in the field; and the heat came upon his head, and he died in Bethulia his own city, and was buried there with his fathers.
column3: For he was standing over them that bound sheaves in the field; and the heat came upon his head, and he died in Bethulia his own city, and was buried there with his fathers.
eight to four.

column2: And Judith his relict was a widow now three years and six months.
column3: And Judith his relict was a widow now three years and six months.
eight to five.

column2: And she made herself a private chamber in the upper part of her house, in which she abode shut up with her maids.
column3: And she made herself a private chamber in the upper part of her house, in which she abode shut up with her maids.
eight to six.

column2: And she wore haircloth upon her loins, and fasted all the days of her life, except the sabbaths, and new moons, and the feasts of the house of Israel.
column3: And she wore haircloth upon her loins, and fasted all the days of her life, except the sabbaths, and new moons, and the feasts of the house of Israel.
eight to seven.

column2: And she was exceedingly beautiful, and her husband left her great riches, and very many servants, and large possessions of herds of oxen, and flocks of sheep.
column3: And she was exceedingly beautiful, and her husband left her great riches, and very many servants, and large possessions of herds of oxen, and flocks of sheep.
eight to eight.

column2: And she was greatly renowned among all, because she feared the Lord very much, neither was there any one that spoke an ill word of her.
column3: And she was greatly renowned among all, because she feared the Lord very much, neither was there any one that spoke an ill word of her.
eight to nine.

column2: When therefore she had heard that Ozias had promised that he would deliver up the city after the fifth day, she sent to the ancients Chabri and Charmi.
column3: When therefore she had heard that Ozias had promised that he would deliver up the city after the fifth day, she sent to the ancients Chabri and Charmi.
eight ten.

column2: And they came to her, and she said to them: What is this word, by which Ozias hath consented to give up the city to the Assyrians, if within five days there come no aid to us?
column3: And they came to her, and she said to them: What is this word, by which Ozias hath consented to give up the city to the Assyrians, if within five days there come no aid to us?
eight eleven.

column2: And who are you that tempt the Lord?
column3: And who are you that tempt the Lord?
eight twelve.

column2: This is not a word that may draw down mercy, but rather that may stir up wrath, and enkindle indignation.
column3: This is not a word that may draw down mercy, but rather that may stir up wrath, and enkindle indignation.
eight thirteen.

column2: You have set a time for the mercy of the Lord, and you have appointed him a day, according to your pleasure.
column3: You have set a time for the mercy of the Lord, and you have appointed him a day, according to your pleasure.
eight fourteen.

column2: But forasmuch as the Lord is patient, let us be penitent for this same thing, and with many tears let us beg his pardon:
column3: But forasmuch as the Lord is patient, let us be penitent for this same thing, and with many tears let us beg his pardon:
eight fifteen.

column2: For God will not threaten like man, nor be inflamed to anger like the son of man.
column3: For God will not threaten like man, nor be inflamed to anger like the son of man.
eight sixteen.

column2: And therefore let us humble our souls before him, and continuing in an humble spirit, in his service:
column3: And therefore let us humble our souls before him, and continuing in an humble spirit, in his service:
eight seventeen.

column2: Let us ask the Lord with tears, that according to his will so he would shew his mercy to us: that as our heart is troubled by their pride, so also we may glorify in our humility.
column3: Let us ask the Lord with tears, that according to his will so he would shew his mercy to us: that as our heart is troubled by their pride, so also we may glorify in our humility.
eight eighteen.

column2: For we have not followed the sins of our fathers, who forsook their God, and worshipped strange gods.
column3: For we have not followed the sins of our fathers, who forsook their God, and worshipped strange gods.
eight nineteen.

column2: For which crime they were given up to their enemies, to the sword, and to pillage, and to confusion: but we know no other God but him.
column3: For which crime they were given up to their enemies, to the sword, and to pillage, and to confusion: but we know no other God but him.
eight twenty.

column2: Let us humbly wait for his consolation, and the Lord our God will require our blood of the afflictions of our enemies, and he will humble all the nations that shall rise up against us, and bring them to disgrace.
column3: Let us humbly wait for his consolation, and the Lord our God will require our blood of the afflictions of our enemies, and he will humble all the nations that shall rise up against us, and bring them to disgrace.
eight twenty one.

column2: And now, brethren, as you are the ancients among the people of God, and their very soul resteth upon you: comfort their hearts by your speech, that they may be mindful how our fathers were tempted that they might be proved, whether they worshipped their God truly.
column3: And now, brethren, as you are the ancients among the people of God, and their very soul resteth upon you: comfort their hearts by your speech, that they may be mindful how our fathers were tempted that they might be proved, whether they worshipped their God truly.
eight twenty two.

column2: They must remember how our father Abraham was tempted, and being proved by many tribulations, was made the friend of God.
column3: They must remember how our father Abraham was tempted, and being proved by many tribulations, was made the friend of God.
eight twenty three.

column2: So Isaac, so Jacob, so Moses, and all that have pleased God, passed through many tribulations, remaining faithful.
column3: So Isaac, so Jacob, so Moses, and all that have pleased God, passed through many tribulations, remaining faithful.
eight twenty four.

column2: But they that did not receive the trials with the fear of the Lord, but uttered their impatience and the reproach of their murmuring against the Lord,
column3: But they that did not receive the trials with the fear of the Lord, but uttered their impatience and the reproach of their murmuring against the Lord,
eight twenty five.

column2: Were destroyed by the destroyer, and perished by serpents.
column3: Were destroyed by the destroyer, and perished by serpents.
eight twenty six.

column2: As for us therefore let us not revenge ourselves for these things which we suffer.
column3: As for us therefore let us not revenge ourselves for these things which we suffer.
eight twenty seven.

column2: But esteeming these very punishments to be less than our sins deserve, let us believe that these scourges of the Lord, with which like servants we are chastised, have happened for our amendment, and not for our destruction.
column3: But esteeming these very punishments to be less than our sins deserve, let us believe that these scourges of the Lord, with which like servants we are chastised, have happened for our amendment, and not for our destruction.
eight twenty eight.

column2: And Ozias and the ancients said to her: All things which thou hast spoken are true, and there is nothing to be reprehended in thy words.
column3: And Ozias and the ancients said to her: All things which thou hast spoken are true, and there is nothing to be reprehended in thy words.
eight twenty nine.

column2: Now therefore pray for us, for thou art a holy woman, and one fearing God.
column3: Now therefore pray for us, for thou art a holy woman, and one fearing God.
eight thirty.

column2: And Judith said to them: As you know that what I have been able to say is of God:
column3: And Judith said to them: As you know that what I have been able to say is of God:
eight thirty one.

column2: So that which I intend to do prove ye if it be of God, and pray that God may strengthen my design.
column3: So that which I intend to do prove ye if it be of God, and pray that God may strengthen my design.
eight thirty two.

column2: You shall stand at the gate this night, and I will go out with my maidservant: and pray ye, that as you have said, in five days the Lord may look down upon his people Israel.
column3: You shall stand at the gate this night, and I will go out with my maidservant: and pray ye, that as you have said, in five days the Lord may look down upon his people Israel.
